User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110706 Firefox/5.0 SeaMonkey/2.2
Build ID: 20110706120824

Steps to reproduce:

Opened Password Manager.  Clicked "Show passwords."


Actual results:

 Seamonkey prompts for Master Password.  I entered it, and password for a single domain are shown.  To show passwords for any other domain, have to go through the same sequence: Click "Show Passwords" and enter Master password, this despite  Master Password Timeout option being "The first time it is needed."


Expected results:

Show all passwords, or at least show them domain by domain without having to click "show passwords" (and enter Master Password) for each.

comments.text:
Confirmed.

Even better ...

Set:
Master Passwords -> Master Password Timeout => The first time it is needed

Then select a domain where both a cookie & a password are saved, say yahoo.com.

1) open "Password Manager"
2) click yahoo.com domain
3) click 'Show Passwords'
(you are prompted for the master password)
<note that you are prompted for this even though you had to enter your master password when the browser opened initially>
4) enter password
(Password column displays, along with the associated passwords)
5) click the 'Cookies' tab
6) click the 'Passwords' tab
(at that point, the previously shown passwords no longer display)
7) click 'Show Passwords'
(you are AGAIN prompted for the master password)
